problem-detail.title: problem-detail
problem-detail.description: Defines a "problem detail" [RFC7807] as a way to carry machine-readable details of errors in a HTTP response to avoid the need to define new error response formats for HTTP APIs.

type.description: A URI reference [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.  This specification encourages that, when dereferenced, it provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

status.description: The HTTP status code ([RFC7231], Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.  It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.  It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

example.title: Your request parameters didn't validate.
example.details: Some errors occured during the validation of your request.

errors.title: Invalid Parameter
errors.detail: Name length should be between 5 and 26
